sentences.en: Fly into a rage at the slightest provocation.
sentences.cn: 为了一点小事就大发脾气.

sentences.en: Great was her provocation, great her love.
sentences.cn: 她的愤怒真了不起, 她的爱情也了不起.

sentences.en: He flares up at the slightest provocation.
sentences.cn: 稍一激他,他就大发脾气.

sentences.en: He keeps his temper despite the provocation.
sentences.cn: 他虽被挑激,但仍忍住怒气.

sentences.en: He reacted violently only under provocation .
sentences.cn: 只因为被激怒，他才暴力相向。

sentences.en: He urged delay to a moment when the provocation would be clearer.
sentences.cn: 他要求暂缓采取行动,等对方挑衅的情况更明朗时再说.

sentences.en: He was accused of deliberate provocation .
He would whomp the kids at the slightest provocation.
He's got a fiery temper and flares up at the slightest provocation.
sentences.cn: 他是火爆性子,一点就着.

sentences.en: Her plea of guilty to manslaughter through provocation was rejected.
sentences.cn: 她因受到挑衅而过失杀人的有罪答辩被驳回。

sentences.en: His presence was an irritation to him, for some reason - a deadly provocation.
sentences.cn: 由于某种原因,他看见他就要发怒 -- 一种致命的激动.

sentences.en: Jack would not have hit the boy without provocation.
sentences.cn: 如果不是那个男孩挑衅,杰克是不会打他的.

sentences.en: Julie has a tendency to burst into tears at the slightest provocation .
sentences.cn: 只要稍一招惹朱莉，她就会大哭起来。

sentences.en: She angers with little or no provocation.
She sometimes angers with little or no provocation.
sentences.cn: 她有时无缘无故就生气.

sentences.en: Their insulting remarks were a provocation.
sentences.cn: 他们侮辱人的话使人愤怒.

sentences.en: They did not react to this provocation.
sentences.cn: 他们对这一挑衅未作反应.

words.tran_cn: 刺激的；令人生气的，激怒人的

trans.tran_cn: 挑衅，挑拨，激怒，刺激，愤怒，愤怒的原因
trans.tran_en: an action or event that makes someone angry or upset, or is intended to do this
